page.title: 02Sharp's Copse(Description)
page.content: Sharp's Copse is situated at the {western side}of Leigh-Park. It was built by{Portsmouth City Council.}When it was built it had problems with vandalism and theft. Now there are less problems,which could reflect the fact that the estate has matured. There is an awful lot of unemployment and only{12%}of the children who have school dinners pay for them. There are large areas of green land for children to play on but there is a lack of places for social activities except for{St Alban's}church hall and {Wakeford's School. More houses are privately owned and this adds to the appearance of the area. Many of the working people particularly women work on the New Lane industrial estate.
